    A GitHost superclass

    GitHost.Rd

    A GitHost superclass

    A GitHost superclass

    Methods

    Public methods

    • GitHost$new()

    • GitHost$pull_repos()

    • GitHost$pull_repos_contributors()

    • GitHost$pull_commits()

    • GitHost$pull_users()

    • GitHost$clone()

    Method new()

    Create a new GitHost object

    Usage

    GitHost$new(orgs = NA, token = NA, api_url = NA)

    Arguments

    orgs

    A character vector of organisations (owners of repositories in case of GitHub and groups of projects in case of GitLab).

    token

    A token.

    api_url

    An API url.

    Returns

    A new GitHost object

    Method pull_repos()

    A method to list all repositories for an organization, a team or by a keyword.

    Usage

    GitHost$pull_repos(settings, add_contributors = FALSE)

    Arguments

    settings

    A list of GitStats settings.

    add_contributors

    A boolean to decide whether to add contributors column to repositories table.

    Returns

    A data.frame of repositories.

    Method pull_repos_contributors()

    A method to add information on repository contributors.

    Usage

    GitHost$pull_repos_contributors(repos_table)

    Arguments

    repos_table

    A table of repositories.

    Returns

    A table of repositories with added information on contributors.

    Method pull_commits()

    A method to get information on commits.

    Usage

    GitHost$pull_commits(date_from, date_until = Sys.Date(), settings)

    Arguments

    date_from

    A starting date to look commits for.

    date_until

    An end date to look commits for.

    settings

    A list of GitStats settings.

    Returns

    A data.frame of commits

    Method pull_users()

    Get information about users

    Usage

    GitHost$pull_users(users)

    Arguments

    users

    A character vector of users

    Returns

    Table of users

    Method clone()

    The objects of this class are cloneable with this method.

    Usage

    GitHost$clone(deep = FALSE)

    Arguments

    deep

    Whether to make a deep clone.
